title: Guitar Masters 11 of 16 Basho-Junghans, Chasny, Emmanuel, Rose
description:
Guitar Masters 11 of 16 Basho-Junghans, Chasny, Emmanuel, Rose

Still today people ask me about the old guitar torrents that I shared years ago at my first times at the Bay.
They often tell me that is difficult to find them all, cause the TPB search engine sucks, cause their trackers are dead and they seem deserted.
So I've decided to reshare them all with a unifying pattern in the name of the torrent:

Guitar Masters

followed by a progressive number, so those who are interested can find them easily.
They deal primarily with fingerstyle, and the albums they contain are not generally easy to find... so dont expect overall 320 bitrates.
The founding criterion here is to find and remember them as a document of great music of the past.

Enjoy :)

STEFFEN BASHO-JUNGHANS

Steffen Basho-Junghans is a German guitarist and composer.
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steffen_Basho-Junghans" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steffen_Basho-Junghans</a>   <a href="
http://www.bluemomentarts.de/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.bluemomentarts.de/</a>

His music starts from fingerstyle and travels very far in the avantgarde realms.
Junghans included the name 'Basho' into his own as a tribute to Robbie Basho whom deeply influenced him. 

(See also my torrent:    <a href="
https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/8816240/Guitar_Masters_01_of_16_Robbie_Basho" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/8816240/Guitar_Masters_01_of_16_Robbie_Basho</a> ).

His music, unorthodox explorations between traditions and experimentation, is influenced by North American Indian, Asian, New music and European classical music.

BEN CHASNY (SIX ORGANS OF ADMITTANCE)


Six Organs of Admittance is the primary musical project of guitarist Ben Chasny. Chasny's music is largely guitar-based and is often considered new folk, however it includes obvious influences, marked by the use of drones, chimes, and eclectic percussive elements.
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Six_organs_of_admittance" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Six_organs_of_admittance</a>   <a href="
http://www.sixorgans.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.sixorgans.com/</a>

You can argue that this is not properly fingerstyle... but listen anyway... Enjoy...

TOMMY EMMANUEL

Tommy Emmanuel is an Australian guitarist, best known for his complex fingerpicking style, energetic performances and the use of percussive effects on the guitar.
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tommy_emmanuel" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tommy_emmanuel</a>   <a href="
http://www.tommyemmanuel.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.tommyemmanuel.com/</a>

Emmanuel has said that even at a young age he was fascinated by AtkinsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ musical style ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ sometimes referred to as Travis picking ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ of playing bass with the thumb and melody parts with the first two or three fingers at the same time. This technique became the basis of Emmanuel's guitar style.

While Emmanuel has never had formal music training, his playing ability has won him fans from all over the world. He is known to play percussion parts on the body of his guitar. As a solo performer he never plays to a set list and uses a minimum of effects. He usually completes recordings in one take.

He frequently uses his left thumb to fret bass notes on the 5th and 6th strings as well as playing chords such as Am and E with just two fingers. He uses a thumb pick mostly, a flat pick or just fingers.


What follows is a collection of some of his albums... Enjoy...

*****************************

JACK ROSE

Jack Rose is an american guitarist and composer.
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Rose" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Rose</a>


His musical experience is deeply influenced by John Fahey and Robbie Basho.
Jack Rose has been a prolific recording artist in his relatively short career, with albums, EPs, and compilation tracks on no less than ten record labels. His major works are made up of the triad of consecutive full-length releases on Eclipse -- Red Horse, White Mule (2002), Opium Musick (2003), and Raag Manifestos (2004) -- in addition to his 2005 opus Kensington Blues, released by Tequila Sunrise.

In 1993 Jack Rose joined the noise/drone band Pelt, releasing a handful of albums and EPs. Rose further developed his acoustic guitar technique as the band slowly shifted from its electric roots. Although Pelt frequently went on and off hiatus during Rose's most involved periods in the band, he didn't begin to concentrate on his own recordings until the early 2000s. 2001 saw his first self-released CD-R of mostly blues and ragtime. In 2002, this new focus culminated in his public transformation from Pelt member to solo artist on his first proper full-length, Red Horse, White Mule, released by Eclipse Records.

His depth of knowledge in the traditions of blues, ragtime and Eastern music are complemented by the avant-garde and experimental spirit of Pelt. Comparisons to American primitive guitarist John Fahey are frequent, but Rose has been praised by reviewers, fans, and contemporaries alike for rising to the challenge of playing in a unique style despite his affection for music originating in decades past.
